      • MPU6050_REG_ADDR_SMPRT_DIV

        public static final int MPU6050_REG_ADDR_SMPRT_DIV
        [datasheet 2 - p.11] Sample Rate Divider

        This register specifies the divider from the gyroscope output rate used to generate the Sample Rate for the MPU-60X0.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MPU6050_REG_ADDR_CONFIG

        public static final int MPU6050_REG_ADDR_CONFIG
        [datasheet 2 - p.13] Configuration

        This register configures the external Frame Synchronization (FSYNC) pin sampling and the Digital Low Pass Filter (DLPF) setting for both the gyroscopes and accelerometers.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MPU6050_REG_ADDR_GYRO_CONFIG

        public static final int MPU6050_REG_ADDR_GYRO_CONFIG
        [datasheet 2 - p.14] Gyroscope Configuration

        This register is used to trigger gyroscope self-test and configure the gyroscopesâ€™ full scale range

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MPU6050_REG_ADDR_ACCEL_CONFIG

        public static final int MPU6050_REG_ADDR_ACCEL_CONFIG
        [datasheet 2 - p.15] Accelerometer Configuration

        This register is used to trigger accelerometer self test and configure the accelerometer full scale range. This register also configures the Digital High Pass Filter (DHPF).

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MPU6050_REG_ADDR_INT_ENABLE

        public static final int MPU6050_REG_ADDR_INT_ENABLE
        [datasheet 2 - p.27] Interrupt Enable

        This register enables interrupt generation by interrupt sources.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MPU6050_REG_ADDR_PWR_MGMT_1

        public static final int MPU6050_REG_ADDR_PWR_MGMT_1
        [datasheet 2 - p.40] Power Management 1

        This register allows the user to configure the power mode and clock source. It also provides a bit for resetting the entire device, and a bit for disabling the temperature sensor.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MPU6050_REG_ADDR_PWR_MGMT_2

        public static final int MPU6050_REG_ADDR_PWR_MGMT_2
        [datasheet 2 - p.42] Power Management 2

        This register allows the user to configure the frequency of wake-ups in Accelerometer Only Low Power Mode. This register also allows the user to put individual axes of the accelerometer and gyroscope into standby mode.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getSampleRate

        public int getSampleRate()
        Returns the Sample Rate of the MPU6050. [datasheet 2 - p.12] The sensor output, FIFO output, and DMP sampling are all based on the Sample Rate ('Fs' in the datasheet). The Sample Rate is generated by dividing the gyroscope output rate by SMPLRT_DIV: Sample Rate = Gyroscope Output Rate / (1 + SMPLRT_DIV) where Gyroscope Output Rate = 8kHz when the DLPF is disabled (DLPF_CFG = 0 or 7), and 1kHz when the DLPF is enabled (see Register 26) Note: The accelerometer output rate is 1kHz (accelerometer and not gyroscope !). This means that for a Sample Rate greater than 1kHz, the same accelerometer sample may be output to the FIFO, DMP, and sensor registers more than once.
        Returns:
        the sample rate, in Hz.

      • setDLPFConfig

        public void setDLPFConfig(int dlpfConfig)
        Sets the value of the DLPF config, according to the datasheet informations. The accelerometer and gyroscope are filtered according to the value of DLPF_CFG as shown in the table [datasheet 2 - p.13].
        Parameters:
        dlpfConfig - the new DLPF_CFG value. Must be in the [0; 7] range, where 0 and 7 are used to disable the DLPF.

      • readScaledAccelerometerValues

        public double[] readScaledAccelerometerValues()
        Reads the most recent accelerometer values on MPU6050 for X, Y and Z axis, and calculates the corresponding accelerations in g, according to the selected AFS_SEL mode.
        Returns:
        [ACCEL_X, ACCEL_Y, ACCEL_Z], the accelerations in g for the x, y and z axis.

      • readScaledGyroscopeValues

        public double[] readScaledGyroscopeValues()
        Reads the most recent gyroscope values on the MPU6050 for X, Y and Z axis, and calculates the corresponding angular speeds in degrees/sec, according to the selected FS_SEL mode.
        Returns:
        [GYRO_X, GYRO_Y, GYRO_Z], the angular velocities in degrees/sec for the x, y and z axis.

      • startUpdatingThread

        public void startUpdatingThread()
        Starts the thread responsible to update MPU6050 values in background.

      • stopUpdatingThread

        public void stopUpdatingThread()
                        throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Stops the thread responsible to update MPU6050 values in background.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if any thread has interrupted the current thread. The interrupted status of the current thread is cleared when this exception is thrown.

      • getAccelAccelerations

        public double[] getAccelAccelerations()
        Get the last acceleration values, in g, retrieved from the accelerometer, for the x, y and z axis.

        (using the updating thread)

        Returns:
        the accelerations for the x, y and z axis. [-1, -1, -1] if the updating thread isn't running.

      • getAccelAngles

        public double[] getAccelAngles()
        Get the last angle values, in Â°, retrieved from the accelerometer, for the x, y and z axis.

        (using the updating thread)

        Returns:
        the angle values for the x, y and z axis. [-1, -1, -1] if the updating thread isn't running.

      • getGyroAngularSpeeds

        public double[] getGyroAngularSpeeds()
        Get the last angular speed values, in Â°/sec, retrieved from the gyroscope, for the x, y and z axis.

        (using the updating thread)

        Returns:
        the angular speed values for the x, y and z axis. [-1, -1, -1] if the updating thread isn't running.

      • getGyroAngles

        public double[] getGyroAngles()
        Get the last angles values, in Â°, retrieved from the gyroscope, for the x, y and z axis.

        (using the updating thread)

        Returns:
        the angles values from the gyroscope for the x, y and z axis. [-1, -1, -1] if the updating thread isn't running.

      • getGyroAngularSpeedsOffsets

        public double[] getGyroAngularSpeedsOffsets()
        Get the calculated offsets for the angular speeds from the gyroscope, for the x, y and z axis.

        (calculated with the calibration function)

        Returns:
        the offsets for the angular speeds from the gyroscope.

      • getFilteredAngles

        public double[] getFilteredAngles()
        Last angle value, in Â°, calculated from the accelerometer and the gyroscope, for the x, y and z axis.

        (using the updating thread)

        Returns:
        the angles values, in Â°, filtered with values from the accelerometer and the gyroscope.
